author: {'steamid': '76561198256728918', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1690314132}
review:
Another "Real-time" Puzzle game and just like other entries in this genre, it is just not that engaging (in my opinion at least).
The puzzle aspect is too shallow, so are the "platforming"-elements and together it manages to annoy more than it engages.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988827286', 'num_games_owned': 2857, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1656870312}
review:
Ehh... it's not the *worst* game, but it feels like it's just a bad base puzzle mechanic, and the puzzles are mostly about trying to remember how dice works. The ones that aren't are super easy. A lot of times, it feels faster to just blindly move around and hope it works.

Which is to say, it feels like they should've scrapped the concept when they discovered it, but didn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039353230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1412123642}
review: This is a very fun puzzle game.  Some of the more advanced levels introduce things like movement mirroring (reverses your intended movement) and a time limit.  On the negative side, the time limit levels, while challenging, can pose a roadblock if you are not enthusiastic about learning/recording precise moves in order to complete the timed levels.  It wouldhave been helpful to set difficulties or bypass the countdown aspect of the timed levels.  Over all a very nice game, and very resonable price.
